title: Inter 3-2 Torino: Thuram hat-trick keeps Serie A champions within reach of top spot
description: Marcus Thuram plundered a hat-trick to propel Inter to a 3-2 victory over 10-man Torino in Saturday’s Serie A clash. The victory places Inter second in the league standings with 14 points, two behind leaders Napoli. Visiting defender Guillermo Maripan was given a straight red card after 20 minutes for a late challenge on Thuram. title: ´I back myself on penalties´, says Everton´s spot-kick hero Pickford
description: Jordan Pickford said he fancied Anthony Gordon would switch up his penalty routine after scoring his last two spot-kicks for Newcastle United. Gordon was a livewire for Newcastle against Everton on Saturday, though the England international ultimately fluffed his lines in the biggest moment of the 0-0 draw at Goodison Park. With 10 minutes remaining […] The post ´I back myself on penalties´, says Everton´s spot-kick hero Pickford appeared first on Soccer News.

title: Leverkusen complacency key in disappointing Kiel draw, says Alonso
description: Xabi Alonso slammed Bayer Leverkusen’s complacency, which saw them squander a two-goal lead to draw with lowly Holstein Kiel ahead of the international break. Victor Boniface and Jonas Hofmann had given the hosts a comfortable advantage after the first eight minutes, but Kiel, yet to win this season, capitalised on Die Werkself’s wastefulness. title: Al-Ahli 1-2 Al-Hilal: Mitrovic double keeps Saudi champions perfect
description: Aleksandar Mitrovic proved to be the difference once again for Al-Hilal as the reigning Saudi Pro League champions beat Al-Ahli 2-1 on Saturday. title: Crystal Palace 0-1 Liverpool: Talking points as Reds secure Premier League top
description: Liverpool returned from their trip to Selhurst Park on Saturday with a 0-1 victory over Crystal Palace, just enough to make sure they remain at the top of the Premier League table after seven rounds. title: Fonseca has no intention of changing winning formula
description: Paulo Fonseca has no intention of changing a winning side, believing continuity is the key for Milan as they prepare to face Fiorentina. Milan went without a win in their first three Serie A matches under Fonseca, but look to have found their groove in the league after winning each of the last three. title: Szczesny made to wait for Barcelona debut
description: Barcelona’s new goalkeeper Wojciech Szczesny will not make his debut against Alaves on Sunday and will instead have to wait until after the international break. title: Brentford defeat ´my worst game as a coach´, says O´Neil
description: Gary O’Neil believes Wolves’ 5-3 defeat against Brentford was his “worst game as a coach” as the visitors remain rooted to the bottom of the Premier League table. title: Everton 0-0 Newcastle United: Pickford penalty heroics deny Goodison old boy Gordon
description: Everton old boy Anthony Gordon saw a penalty saved on his return to Goodison Park as Newcastle United were held to a 0-0 draw on Saturday. title: Arsenal ´always find a way´ – Arteta
description: Mikel Arteta showered praise on his Arsenal players after their 3-1 victory against Southampton, saying his squad will “always find a way” to win.
